intro: Cacalia octantha, commonly known as the common bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Cacalia octantha is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
